1use std::collections::BTreeMap;
2use std::mem;
3use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicUsize, Ordering};
4use std::sync::{Arc, Mutex};
5
6use crate::compiler::instructions::{
7    Instruction, Instructions, LOOP_FLAG_RECURSIVE, LOOP_FLAG_WITH_LOOP_VAR, MAX_LOCALS,
8};
9use crate::environment::Environment;
10use crate::error::{Error, ErrorKind};
11use crate::output::{CaptureMode, Output};
12use crate::utils::{untrusted_size_hint, AutoEscape, UndefinedBehavior};
13use crate::value::namespace_object::Namespace;
14use crate::value::{ops, value_map_with_capacity, value_optimization, Kwargs, Value};
15use crate::vm::context::{Frame, LoopState, Stack};
16use crate::vm::loop_object::Loop;
17use crate::vm::state::BlockStack;
18
19#[cfg(feature = "macros")]
20use crate::vm::closure_object::Closure;
21
22pub(crate) use crate::vm::context::Context;
23pub use crate::vm::state::State;
24
25#[cfg(feature = "macros")]
26mod closure_object;
27mod context;
28#[cfg(feature = "fuel")]
29mod fuel;
30mod loop_object;
31#[cfg(feature = "macros")]
32mod macro_object;
33mod state;
34
35// the cost of a single include against the stack limit.
36#[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
37const INCLUDE_RECURSION_COST: usize = 10;
38
39// the cost of a single macro call against the stack limit.
40#[cfg(feature = "macros")]
41const MACRO_RECURSION_COST: usize = 5;
42
43/// Helps to evaluate something.
44#[cfg_attr(feature = "internal_debug", derive(Debug))]
45pub struct Vm<'env> {
46    env: &'env Environment<'env>,
47}
48
49pub(crate) fn prepare_blocks<'env, 'template>(
50    blocks: &'template BTreeMap<&'env str, Instructions<'env>>,
51) -> BTreeMap<&'env str, BlockStack<'template, 'env>> {
52    blocks
53        .iter()
54        .map(|(name, instr)| (*name, BlockStack::new(instr)))
55        .collect()
56}
57
58fn get_or_lookup_local<T, F>(vec: &mut [Option<T>], local_id: u8, f: F) -> Option<T>
59where
60    T: Copy,
61    F: FnOnce() -> Option<T>,
62{
63    if local_id == !0 {
64        f()
65    } else if let Some(Some(rv)) = vec.get(local_id as usize) {
66        Some(*rv)
67    } else {
68        let val = some!(f());
69        vec[local_id as usize] = Some(val);
70        Some(val)
71    }
72}
73
74impl<'env> Vm<'env> {
75    /// Creates a new VM.
76    pub fn new(env: &'env Environment<'env>) -> Vm<'env> {
77        Vm { env }
78    }
79
80    /// Evaluates the given inputs.
81    ///
82    /// It returns both the last value left on the stack as well as the state
83    /// at the end of the evaluation.
84    pub fn eval<'template>(
85        &self,
86        instructions: &'template Instructions<'env>,
87        root: Value,
88        blocks: &'template BTreeMap<&'env str, Instructions<'env>>,
89        out: &mut Output,
90        auto_escape: AutoEscape,
91    ) -> Result<(Option<Value>, State<'template, 'env>), Error> {
92        let _guard = value_optimization();
93        let mut state = State::new(
94            self.env,
95            Context::new_with_frame(ok!(Frame::new_checked(root)), self.env.recursion_limit()),
96            auto_escape,
97            instructions,
98            prepare_blocks(blocks),
99        );
100        self.eval_state(&mut state, out).map(|x| (x, state))
101    }
102
103    /// Evaluate a macro in a state.
104    #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
105    #[allow(clippy::too_many_arguments)]
106    pub fn eval_macro(
107        &self,
108        instructions: &Instructions<'env>,
109        pc: usize,
110        closure: Value,
111        caller: Option<Value>,
112        out: &mut Output,
113        state: &State,
114        args: Vec<Value>,
115    ) -> Result<Option<Value>, Error> {
116        let mut ctx = Context::new_with_frame(Frame::new(closure), self.env.recursion_limit());
117        if let Some(caller) = caller {
118            ctx.store("caller", caller);
119        }
120        ok!(ctx.incr_depth(state.ctx.depth() + MACRO_RECURSION_COST));
121        self.do_eval(
122            &mut State {
123                env: self.env,
124                ctx,
125                current_block: None,
126                auto_escape: state.auto_escape(),
127                instructions,
128                blocks: BTreeMap::default(),
129                loaded_templates: Default::default(),
130                #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
131                id: state.id,
132                #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
133                macros: state.macros.clone(),
134                #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
135                closure_tracker: state.closure_tracker.clone(),
136                #[cfg(feature = "fuel")]
137                fuel_tracker: state.fuel_tracker.clone(),
138            },
139            out,
140            Stack::from(args),
141            pc,
142        )
143    }
144
145    /// This is the actual evaluation loop that works with a specific context.
146    #[inline(always)]
147    fn eval_state(
148        &self,
149        state: &mut State<'_, 'env>,
150        out: &mut Output,
151    ) -> Result<Option<Value>, Error> {
152        self.do_eval(state, out, Stack::default(), 0)
153    }
154
155    /// Performs the actual evaluation, optionally with stack growth functionality.
156    fn do_eval(
157        &self,
158        state: &mut State<'_, 'env>,
159        out: &mut Output,
160        stack: Stack,
161        pc: usize,
162    ) -> Result<Option<Value>, Error> {
163        #[cfg(feature = "stacker")]
164        {
165            stacker::maybe_grow(32 * 1024, 1024 * 1024, || {
166                self.eval_impl(state, out, stack, pc)
167            })
168        }
169        #[cfg(not(feature = "stacker"))]
170        {
171            self.eval_impl(state, out, stack, pc)
172        }
173    }
174
175    #[inline]
176    fn eval_impl(
177        &self,
178        state: &mut State<'_, 'env>,
179        out: &mut Output,
180        mut stack: Stack,
181        mut pc: usize,
182    ) -> Result<Option<Value>, Error> {
183        let initial_auto_escape = state.auto_escape;
184        let undefined_behavior = state.undefined_behavior();
185        let mut auto_escape_stack = vec![];
186        let mut next_loop_recursion_jump = None;
187        let mut loaded_filters = [None; MAX_LOCALS];
188        let mut loaded_tests = [None; MAX_LOCALS];
189
190        // If we are extending we are holding the instructions of the target parent
191        // template here.  This is used to detect multiple extends and the evaluation
192        // uses these instructions when it makes it to the end of the instructions.
193        #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
194        let mut parent_instructions = None;
195
196        macro_rules! recurse_loop {
197            ($capture:expr) => {{
198                let jump_target = ctx_ok!(self.prepare_loop_recursion(state));
199                // the way this works is that we remember the next instruction
200                // as loop exit jump target.  Whenever a loop is pushed, it
201                // memorizes the value in `next_loop_iteration_jump` to jump
202                // to.
203                next_loop_recursion_jump = Some((pc + 1, $capture));
204                if $capture {
205                    out.begin_capture(CaptureMode::Capture);
206                }
207                pc = jump_target;
208                continue;
209            }};
210        }
211
212        // looks nicer nice way
213        #[allow(clippy::while_let_loop)]
214        loop {
215            let instr = match state.instructions.get(pc) {
216                Some(instr) => instr,
217                #[cfg(not(feature = "multi_template"))]
218                None => break,
219                #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
220                None => {
221                    // when an extends statement appears in a template, when we hit the
222                    // last instruction we need to check if parent instructions were
223                    // stashed away (which means we found an extends tag which invoked
224                    // `LoadBlocks`).  If we do find instructions, we reset back to 0
225                    // from the new instructions.
226                    state.instructions = match parent_instructions.take() {
227                        Some(instr) => instr,
228                        None => break,
229                    };
230                    out.end_capture(AutoEscape::None);
231                    pc = 0;
232                    continue;
233                }
234            };
235
236            // if we only have two arguments that we pull from the stack, we
237            // can assign them to a and b.  This slightly reduces the amount of
238            // code bloat generated here.
239            let a;
240            let b;
241            let mut err;
242
243            macro_rules! func_binop {
244                ($method:ident) => {{
245                    b = stack.pop();
246                    a = stack.pop();
247                    stack.push(ctx_ok!(ops::$method(&a, &b)));
248                }};
249            }
250
251            macro_rules! op_binop {
252                ($op:tt) => {{
253                    b = stack.pop();
254                    a = stack.pop();
255                    stack.push(Value::from(a $op b));
256                }};
257            }
258
259            macro_rules! bail {
260                ($err:expr) => {{
261                    err = $err;
262                    process_err(&mut err, pc, state);
263                    return Err(err);
264                }};
265            }
266
267            macro_rules! ctx_ok {
268                ($expr:expr) => {
269                    match $expr {
270                        Ok(rv) => rv,
271                        Err(err) => bail!(err),
272                    }
273                };
274            }
275
276            macro_rules! assert_valid {
277                ($expr:expr) => {{
278                    let val = $expr;
279                    match val.validate() {
280                        Ok(val) => val,
281                        Err(err) => bail!(err),
282                    }
283                }};
284            }
285
286            // if the fuel consumption feature is enabled, track the fuel
287            // consumption here.
288            #[cfg(feature = "fuel")]
289            if let Some(ref tracker) = state.fuel_tracker {
290                ctx_ok!(tracker.track(instr));
291            }
292
293            match instr {
294                Instruction::Swap => {
295                    let a = stack.pop();
296                    let b = stack.pop();
297                    stack.push(a);
298                    stack.push(b);
299                }
300                Instruction::EmitRaw(val) => {
301                    // this only produces a format error, no need to attach
302                    // location information.
303                    ok!(out.write_str(val).map_err(Error::from));
304                }
305                Instruction::Emit => {
306                    ctx_ok!(self.env.format(&stack.pop(), state, out));
307                }
308                Instruction::StoreLocal(name) => {
309                    state.ctx.store(name, stack.pop());
310                }
311                Instruction::Lookup(name) => {
312                    stack.push(assert_valid!(state
313                        .lookup(name)
314                        .unwrap_or(Value::UNDEFINED)));
315                }
316                Instruction::GetAttr(name) => {
317                    a = stack.pop();
318                    // This is a common enough operation that it's interesting to consider a fast
319                    // path here.  This is slightly faster than the regular attr lookup because we
320                    // do not need to pass down the error object for the more common success case.
321                    // Only when we cannot look up something, we start to consider the undefined
322                    // special case.
323                    stack.push(match a.get_attr_fast(name) {
324                        Some(value) => assert_valid!(value),
325                        None => ctx_ok!(undefined_behavior.handle_undefined(a.is_undefined())),
326                    });
327                }
328                Instruction::SetAttr(name) => {
329                    b = stack.pop();
330                    a = stack.pop();
331                    if let Some(ns) = b.downcast_object_ref::<Namespace>() {
332                        ns.set_value(name, a);
333                    } else {
334                        bail!(Error::new(
335                            ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
336                            format!("can only assign to namespaces, not {}", b.kind())
337                        ));
338                    }
339                }
340                Instruction::GetItem => {
341                    a = stack.pop();
342                    b = stack.pop();
343                    stack.push(match b.get_item_opt(&a) {
344                        Some(value) => assert_valid!(value),
345                        None => ctx_ok!(undefined_behavior.handle_undefined(b.is_undefined())),
346                    });
347                }
348                Instruction::Slice => {
349                    let step = stack.pop();
350                    let stop = stack.pop();
351                    b = stack.pop();
352                    a = stack.pop();
353                    if a.is_undefined() && matches!(undefined_behavior, UndefinedBehavior::Strict) {
354                        bail!(Error::from(ErrorKind::UndefinedError));
355                    }
356                    stack.push(ctx_ok!(ops::slice(a, b, stop, step)));
357                }
358                Instruction::LoadConst(value) => {
359                    stack.push(value.clone());
360                }
361                Instruction::BuildMap(pair_count) => {
362                    let mut map = value_map_with_capacity(*pair_count);
363                    for _ in 0..*pair_count {
364                        let value = stack.pop();
365                        let key = stack.pop();
366                        map.insert(key, value);
367                    }
368                    stack.push(Value::from_object(map))
369                }
370                Instruction::BuildKwargs(pair_count) => {
371                    let mut map = value_map_with_capacity(*pair_count);
372                    for _ in 0..*pair_count {
373                        let value = stack.pop();
374                        let key = stack.pop();
375                        map.insert(key, value);
376                    }
377                    stack.push(Kwargs::wrap(map))
378                }
379                Instruction::BuildList(n) => {
380                    let count = n.unwrap_or_else(|| stack.pop().try_into().unwrap());
381                    let mut v = Vec::with_capacity(untrusted_size_hint(count));
382                    for _ in 0..count {
383                        v.push(stack.pop());
384                    }
385                    v.reverse();
386                    stack.push(Value::from_object(v))
387                }
388                Instruction::UnpackList(count) => {
389                    ctx_ok!(self.unpack_list(&mut stack, *count));
390                }
391                Instruction::Add => func_binop!(add),
392                Instruction::Sub => func_binop!(sub),
393                Instruction::Mul => func_binop!(mul),
394                Instruction::Div => func_binop!(div),
395                Instruction::IntDiv => func_binop!(int_div),
396                Instruction::Rem => func_binop!(rem),
397                Instruction::Pow => func_binop!(pow),
398                Instruction::Eq => op_binop!(==),
399                Instruction::Ne => op_binop!(!=),
400                Instruction::Gt => op_binop!(>),
401                Instruction::Gte => op_binop!(>=),
402                Instruction::Lt => op_binop!(<),
403                Instruction::Lte => op_binop!(<=),
404                Instruction::Not => {
405                    a = stack.pop();
406                    stack.push(Value::from(!a.is_true()));
407                }
408                Instruction::StringConcat => {
409                    a = stack.pop();
410                    b = stack.pop();
411                    stack.push(ops::string_concat(b, &a));
412                }
413                Instruction::In => {
414                    a = stack.pop();
415                    b = stack.pop();
416                    // the in-operator can fail if the value is undefined and
417                    // we are in strict mode.
418                    ctx_ok!(state.undefined_behavior().assert_iterable(&a));
419                    stack.push(ctx_ok!(ops::contains(&a, &b)));
420                }
421                Instruction::Neg => {
422                    a = stack.pop();
423                    stack.push(ctx_ok!(ops::neg(&a)));
424                }
425                Instruction::PushWith => {
426                    ctx_ok!(state.ctx.push_frame(Frame::default()));
427                }
428                Instruction::PopFrame => {
429                    if let Some(mut loop_ctx) = state.ctx.pop_frame().current_loop {
430                        if let Some((target, end_capture)) = loop_ctx.current_recursion_jump.take()
431                        {
432                            pc = target;
433                            if end_capture {
434                                stack.push(out.end_capture(state.auto_escape));
435                            }
436                            continue;
437                        }
438                    }
439                }
440                #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
441                Instruction::IsUndefined => {
442                    a = stack.pop();
443                    stack.push(Value::from(a.is_undefined()));
444                }
445                Instruction::PushLoop(flags) => {
446                    a = stack.pop();
447                    ctx_ok!(self.push_loop(state, a, *flags, pc, next_loop_recursion_jump.take()));
448                }
449                Instruction::Iterate(jump_target) => {
450                    let l = state.ctx.current_loop().unwrap();
451                    l.object.idx.fetch_add(1, Ordering::Relaxed);
452
453                    let next = {
454                        #[cfg(feature = "adjacent_loop_items")]
455                        {
456                            let mut triple = l.object.value_triple.lock().unwrap();
457                            triple.0 = triple.1.take();
458                            triple.1 = triple.2.take();
459                            triple.2 = l.iterator.next();
460                            triple.1.clone()
461                        }
462                        #[cfg(not(feature = "adjacent_loop_items"))]
463                        {
464                            l.iterator.next()
465                        }
466                    };
467                    match next {
468                        Some(item) => stack.push(assert_valid!(item)),
469                        None => {
470                            pc = *jump_target;
471                            continue;
472                        }
473                    };
474                }
475                Instruction::PushDidNotIterate => {
476                    let l = state.ctx.current_loop().unwrap();
477                    stack.push(Value::from(l.object.idx.load(Ordering::Relaxed) == 0));
478                }
479                Instruction::Jump(jump_target) => {
480                    pc = *jump_target;
481                    continue;
482                }
483                Instruction::JumpIfFalse(jump_target) => {
484                    a = stack.pop();
485                    if !ok!(undefined_behavior.is_true(&a)) {
486                        pc = *jump_target;
487                        continue;
488                    }
489                }
490                Instruction::JumpIfFalseOrPop(jump_target) => {
491                    if !ok!(undefined_behavior.is_true(stack.peek())) {
492                        pc = *jump_target;
493                        continue;
494                    } else {
495                        stack.pop();
496                    }
497                }
498                Instruction::JumpIfTrueOrPop(jump_target) => {
499                    if ok!(undefined_behavior.is_true(stack.peek())) {
500                        pc = *jump_target;
501                        continue;
502                    } else {
503                        stack.pop();
504                    }
505                }
506                #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
507                Instruction::CallBlock(name) => {
508                    if parent_instructions.is_none() && !out.is_discarding() {
509                        self.call_block(name, state, out)?;
510                    }
511                }
512                Instruction::PushAutoEscape => {
513                    a = stack.pop();
514                    auto_escape_stack.push(state.auto_escape);
515                    state.auto_escape = ctx_ok!(self.derive_auto_escape(a, initial_auto_escape));
516                }
517                Instruction::PopAutoEscape => {
518                    state.auto_escape = auto_escape_stack.pop().unwrap();
519                }
520                Instruction::BeginCapture(mode) => {
521                    out.begin_capture(*mode);
522                }
523                Instruction::EndCapture => {
524                    stack.push(out.end_capture(state.auto_escape));
525                }
526                Instruction::ApplyFilter(name, arg_count, local_id) => {
527                    let filter =
528                        ctx_ok!(get_or_lookup_local(&mut loaded_filters, *local_id, || {
529                            state.env.get_filter(name)
530                        })
531                        .ok_or_else(|| {
532                            Error::new(
533                                ErrorKind::UnknownFilter,
534                                format!("filter {name} is unknown"),
535                            )
536                        }));
537                    let args = stack.slice_top(*arg_count);
538                    a = ctx_ok!(filter.apply_to(state, args));
539                    stack.drop_top(*arg_count);
540                    stack.push(a);
541                }
542                Instruction::PerformTest(name, arg_count, local_id) => {
543                    let test = ctx_ok!(get_or_lookup_local(&mut loaded_tests, *local_id, || {
544                        state.env.get_test(name)
545                    })
546                    .ok_or_else(|| {
547                        Error::new(ErrorKind::UnknownTest, format!("test {name} is unknown"))
548                    }));
549                    let args = stack.slice_top(*arg_count);
550                    let rv = ctx_ok!(test.perform(state, args));
551                    stack.drop_top(*arg_count);
552                    stack.push(Value::from(rv));
553                }
554                Instruction::CallFunction(name, arg_count) => {
555                    // super is a special function reserved for super-ing into blocks.
556                    if *name == "super" {
557                        if *arg_count != 0 {
558                            bail!(Error::new(
559                                ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
560                                "super() takes no arguments",
561                            ));
562                        }
563                        stack.push(ctx_ok!(self.perform_super(state, out, true)));
564                    // loop is a special name which when called recurses the current loop.
565                    } else if *name == "loop" {
566                        if *arg_count != 1 {
567                            bail!(Error::new(
568                                ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
569                                format!("loop() takes one argument, got {}", *arg_count)
570                            ));
571                        }
572                        // leave the one argument on the stack for the recursion
573                        recurse_loop!(true);
574                    } else if let Some(func) = state.lookup(name) {
575                        let args = stack.slice_top(*arg_count);
576                        a = ctx_ok!(func.call(state, args));
577                        stack.drop_top(*arg_count);
578                        stack.push(a);
579                    } else {
580                        bail!(Error::new(
581                            ErrorKind::UnknownFunction,
582                            format!("{name} is unknown"),
583                        ));
584                    }
585                }
586                Instruction::CallMethod(name, arg_count) => {
587                    let args = stack.slice_top(*arg_count);
588                    a = ctx_ok!(args[0].call_method(state, name, &args[1..]));
589                    stack.drop_top(*arg_count);
590                    stack.push(a);
591                }
592                Instruction::CallObject(arg_count) => {
593                    let args = stack.slice_top(*arg_count);
594                    a = ctx_ok!(args[0].call(state, &args[1..]));
595                    stack.drop_top(*arg_count);
596                    stack.push(a);
597                }
598                Instruction::DupTop => {
599                    stack.push(stack.peek().clone());
600                }
601                Instruction::DiscardTop => {
602                    stack.pop();
603                }
604                Instruction::FastSuper => {
605                    ctx_ok!(self.perform_super(state, out, false));
606                }
607                Instruction::FastRecurse => {
608                    recurse_loop!(false);
609                }
610                // Explanation on the behavior of `LoadBlocks` and rendering of
611                // inherited templates:
612                //
613                // MiniJinja inherits the behavior from Jinja2 where extending
614                // loads the blocks (`LoadBlocks`) and the rest of the template
615                // keeps executing but with output disabled, only at the end the
616                // parent template is then invoked.  This has the effect that
617                // you can still set variables or declare macros and that they
618                // become visible in the blocks.
619                //
620                // This behavior has a few downsides.  First of all what happens
621                // in the parent template overrides what happens in the child.
622                // For instance if you declare a macro named `foo` after `{%
623                // extends %}` and then a variable with that named is also set
624                // in the parent template, then you won't be able to call that
625                // macro in the body.
626                //
627                // The reason for this is that blocks unlike macros do not have
628                // closures in Jinja2/MiniJinja.
629                //
630                // However for the common case this is convenient because it
631                // lets you put some imports there and for as long as you do not
632                // create name clashes this works fine.
633                #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
634                Instruction::LoadBlocks => {
635                    a = stack.pop();
636                    if parent_instructions.is_some() {
637                        bail!(Error::new(
638                            ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
639                            "tried to extend a second time in a template"
640                        ));
641                    }
642                    parent_instructions = Some(ctx_ok!(self.load_blocks(a, state)));
643                    out.begin_capture(CaptureMode::Discard);
644                }
645                #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
646                Instruction::Include(ignore_missing) => {
647                    a = stack.pop();
648                    ctx_ok!(self.perform_include(a, state, out, *ignore_missing));
649                }
650                #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
651                Instruction::ExportLocals => {
652                    let locals = state.ctx.current_locals_mut();
653                    let mut module = value_map_with_capacity(locals.len());
654                    for (key, value) in locals.iter() {
655                        module.insert(Value::from(*key), value.clone());
656                    }
657                    stack.push(Value::from_object(module));
658                }
659                #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
660                Instruction::BuildMacro(name, offset, flags) => {
661                    self.build_macro(&mut stack, state, *offset, name, *flags);
662                }
663                #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
664                Instruction::Return => break,
665                #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
666                Instruction::Enclose(name) => {
667                    // the first time we enclose a value, we need to create a closure
668                    // and store it on the context, and add it to the closure tracker
669                    // for cycle breaking.
670                    if state.ctx.closure().is_none() {
671                        let closure = Arc::new(Closure::default());
672                        state.closure_tracker.track_closure(closure.clone());
673                        state.ctx.reset_closure(Some(closure));
674                    }
675                    state.ctx.enclose(state.env, name);
676                }
677                #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
678                Instruction::GetClosure => {
679                    stack.push(
680                        state
681                            .ctx
682                            .closure()
683                            .map_or(Value::UNDEFINED, |x| Value::from_dyn_object(x.clone())),
684                    );
685                }
686            }
687            pc += 1;
688        }
689
690        Ok(stack.try_pop())
691    }
692
693    #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
694    fn perform_include(
695        &self,
696        name: Value,
697        state: &mut State<'_, 'env>,
698        out: &mut Output,
699        ignore_missing: bool,
700    ) -> Result<(), Error> {
701        let obj = name.as_object();
702        let choices = obj
703            .as_ref()
704            .and_then(|d| d.try_iter())
705            .into_iter()
706            .flatten()
707            .chain(obj.is_none().then(|| name.clone()));
708
709        let mut templates_tried = vec![];
710        for choice in choices {
711            let name = ok!(choice.as_str().ok_or_else(|| {
712                Error::new(
713                    ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
714                    "template name was not a string",
715                )
716            }));
717            let tmpl = match state.get_template(name) {
718                Ok(tmpl) => tmpl,
719                Err(err) => {
720                    if err.kind() == ErrorKind::TemplateNotFound {
721                        templates_tried.push(choice);
722                    } else {
723                        return Err(err);
724                    }
725                    continue;
726                }
727            };
728
729            let (new_instructions, new_blocks) = ok!(tmpl.instructions_and_blocks());
730            let old_escape = mem::replace(&mut state.auto_escape, tmpl.initial_auto_escape());
731            let old_instructions = mem::replace(&mut state.instructions, new_instructions);
732            let old_blocks = mem::replace(&mut state.blocks, prepare_blocks(new_blocks));
733            ok!(state.ctx.incr_depth(INCLUDE_RECURSION_COST));
734            let rv;
735            #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
736            {
737                let old_closure = state.ctx.take_closure();
738                rv = self.eval_state(state, out);
739                state.ctx.reset_closure(old_closure);
740            }
741            #[cfg(not(feature = "macros"))]
742            {
743                rv = self.eval_state(state, out);
744            }
745            state.ctx.decr_depth(INCLUDE_RECURSION_COST);
746            state.auto_escape = old_escape;
747            state.instructions = old_instructions;
748            state.blocks = old_blocks;
749            ok!(rv.map_err(|err| {
750                Error::new(
751                    ErrorKind::BadInclude,
752                    format!("error in \"{}\"", tmpl.name()),
753                )
754                .with_source(err)
755            }));
756            return Ok(());
757        }
758        if !templates_tried.is_empty() && !ignore_missing {
759            Err(Error::new(
760                ErrorKind::TemplateNotFound,
761                if templates_tried.len() == 1 {
762                    format!(
763                        "tried to include non-existing template {:?}",
764                        templates_tried[0]
765                    )
766                } else {
767                    format!(
768                        "tried to include one of multiple templates, none of which existed {}",
769                        Value::from(templates_tried)
770                    )
771                },
772            ))
773        } else {
774            Ok(())
775        }
776    }
777
778    fn perform_super(
779        &self,
780        state: &mut State<'_, 'env>,
781        out: &mut Output,
782        capture: bool,
783    ) -> Result<Value, Error> {
784        let name = ok!(state.current_block.ok_or_else(|| {
785            Error::new(ErrorKind::InvalidOperation, "cannot super outside of block")
786        }));
787
788        let block_stack = state.blocks.get_mut(name).unwrap();
789        if !block_stack.push() {
790            return Err(Error::new(
791                ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
792                "no parent block exists",
793            ));
794        }
795
796        if capture {
797            out.begin_capture(CaptureMode::Capture);
798        }
799
800        let old_instructions = mem::replace(&mut state.instructions, block_stack.instructions());
801        ok!(state.ctx.push_frame(Frame::default()));
802        let rv = self.eval_state(state, out);
803        state.ctx.pop_frame();
804        state.instructions = old_instructions;
805        state.blocks.get_mut(name).unwrap().pop();
806
807        ok!(rv.map_err(|err| {
808            Error::new(ErrorKind::EvalBlock, "error in super block").with_source(err)
809        }));
810        if capture {
811            Ok(out.end_capture(state.auto_escape))
812        } else {
813            Ok(Value::UNDEFINED)
814        }
815    }
816
817    fn prepare_loop_recursion(&self, state: &mut State) -> Result<usize, Error> {
818        if let Some(loop_ctx) = state.ctx.current_loop() {
819            if let Some(recurse_jump_target) = loop_ctx.recurse_jump_target {
820                Ok(recurse_jump_target)
821            } else {
822                Err(Error::new(
823                    ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
824                    "cannot recurse outside of recursive loop",
825                ))
826            }
827        } else {
828            Err(Error::new(
829                ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
830                "cannot recurse outside of loop",
831            ))
832        }
833    }
834
835    #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
836    fn load_blocks(
837        &self,
838        name: Value,
839        state: &mut State<'_, 'env>,
840    ) -> Result<&'env Instructions<'env>, Error> {
841        let name = match name.as_str() {
842            Some(name) => name,
843            None => {
844                return Err(Error::new(
845                    ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
846                    "template name was not a string",
847                ))
848            }
849        };
850        if state.loaded_templates.contains(&name) {
851            return Err(Error::new(
852                ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
853                format!("cycle in template inheritance. {name:?} was referenced more than once"),
854            ));
855        }
856        let tmpl = ok!(state.get_template(name));
857        let (new_instructions, new_blocks) = ok!(tmpl.instructions_and_blocks());
858        state.loaded_templates.insert(new_instructions.name());
859        for (name, instr) in new_blocks.iter() {
860            state
861                .blocks
862                .entry(name)
863                .or_default()
864                .append_instructions(instr);
865        }
866        Ok(new_instructions)
867    }
868
869    #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
870    pub(crate) fn call_block(
871        &self,
872        name: &str,
873        state: &mut State<'_, 'env>,
874        out: &mut Output,
875    ) -> Result<Option<Value>, Error> {
876        if let Some((name, block_stack)) = state.blocks.get_key_value(name) {
877            let old_block = mem::replace(&mut state.current_block, Some(name));
878            let old_instructions =
879                mem::replace(&mut state.instructions, block_stack.instructions());
880            state.ctx.push_frame(Frame::default())?;
881            let rv = self.eval_state(state, out);
882            state.ctx.pop_frame();
883            state.instructions = old_instructions;
884            state.current_block = old_block;
885            rv
886        } else {
887            Err(Error::new(
888                ErrorKind::UnknownBlock,
889                format!("block '{}' not found", name),
890            ))
891        }
892    }
893
894    fn derive_auto_escape(
895        &self,
896        value: Value,
897        initial_auto_escape: AutoEscape,
898    ) -> Result<AutoEscape, Error> {
899        match (value.as_str(), value == Value::from(true)) {
900            (Some("html"), _) => Ok(AutoEscape::Html),
901            #[cfg(feature = "json")]
902            (Some("json"), _) => Ok(AutoEscape::Json),
903            (Some("none"), _) | (None, false) => Ok(AutoEscape::None),
904            (None, true) => Ok(if matches!(initial_auto_escape, AutoEscape::None) {
905                AutoEscape::Html
906            } else {
907                initial_auto_escape
908            }),
909            _ => Err(Error::new(
910                ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
911                "invalid value to autoescape tag",
912            )),
913        }
914    }
915
916    fn push_loop(
917        &self,
918        state: &mut State<'_, 'env>,
919        iterable: Value,
920        flags: u8,
921        pc: usize,
922        current_recursion_jump: Option<(usize, bool)>,
923    ) -> Result<(), Error> {
924        #[allow(unused_mut)]
925        let mut iterator = ok!(state.undefined_behavior().try_iter(iterable));
926        // for an iterator where the lower and upper bound are matching we can
927        // consider them to have ExactSizeIterator semantics.  We do however not
928        // expect ExactSizeIterator bounds themselves to support iteration by
929        // other means.
930        let len = match iterator.size_hint() {
931            (lower, Some(upper)) if lower == upper => Some(lower),
932            _ => None,
933        };
934        let depth = state
935            .ctx
936            .current_loop()
937            .filter(|x| x.recurse_jump_target.is_some())
938            .map_or(0, |x| x.object.depth + 1);
939        let recursive = flags & LOOP_FLAG_RECURSIVE != 0;
940        let with_loop_var = flags & LOOP_FLAG_WITH_LOOP_VAR != 0;
941        ok!(state.ctx.push_frame(Frame {
942            current_loop: Some(LoopState {
943                with_loop_var,
944                recurse_jump_target: if recursive { Some(pc) } else { None },
945                current_recursion_jump,
946                object: Arc::new(Loop {
947                    idx: AtomicUsize::new(!0usize),
948                    len,
949                    depth,
950                    #[cfg(feature = "adjacent_loop_items")]
951                    value_triple: Mutex::new((None, None, iterator.next())),
952                    last_changed_value: Mutex::default(),
953                }),
954                iterator,
955            }),
956            ..Frame::default()
957        }));
958        Ok(())
959    }
960
961    fn unpack_list(&self, stack: &mut Stack, count: usize) -> Result<(), Error> {
962        let top = stack.pop();
963        let iter = ok!(top
964            .as_object()
965            .and_then(|x| x.try_iter())
966            .ok_or_else(|| Error::new(ErrorKind::CannotUnpack, "value is not iterable")));
967
968        let mut n = 0;
969        for item in iter {
970            stack.push(item);
971            n += 1;
972        }
973
974        if n == count {
975            stack.reverse_top(n);
976            Ok(())
977        } else {
978            Err(Error::new(
979                ErrorKind::CannotUnpack,
980                format!("sequence of wrong length (expected {}, got {})", count, n,),
981            ))
982        }
983    }
984
985    #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
986    fn build_macro(
987        &self,
988        stack: &mut Stack,
989        state: &mut State,
990        offset: usize,
991        name: &str,
992        flags: u8,
993    ) {
994        use crate::{compiler::instructions::MACRO_CALLER, vm::macro_object::Macro};
995
996        let arg_spec = stack.pop().try_iter().unwrap().collect();
997        let closure = stack.pop();
998        let macro_ref_id = state.macros.len();
999        Arc::make_mut(&mut state.macros).push((state.instructions, offset));
1000        stack.push(Value::from_object(Macro {
1001            name: Value::from(name),
1002            arg_spec,
1003            macro_ref_id,
1004            state_id: state.id,
1005            closure,
1006            caller_reference: (flags & MACRO_CALLER) != 0,
1007        }));
1008    }
1009}
1010
1011#[inline(never)]
1012#[cold]
1013fn process_err(err: &mut Error, pc: usize, state: &State) {
1014    // only attach line information if the error does not have line info yet.
1015    if err.line().is_none() {
1016        if let Some(span) = state.instructions.get_span(pc) {
1017            err.set_filename_and_span(state.instructions.name(), span);
1018        } else if let Some(lineno) = state.instructions.get_line(pc) {
1019            err.set_filename_and_line(state.instructions.name(), lineno);
1020        }
1021    }
1022    // only attach debug info if we don't have one yet and we are in debug mode.
1023    #[cfg(feature = "debug")]
1024    {
1025        if state.env.debug() && err.debug_info().is_none() {
1026            err.attach_debug_info(state.make_debug_info(pc, state.instructions));
1027        }
1028    }
1029}
